diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +96,100 @@  # Set the suffix to '.so' and the prefix to 'lib'
  set_target_properties(${libname} PROPERTIES  ${ROOT_LIBRARY_PROPERTIES})
  if(MSVC)
    set_target_properties(${libname} PROPERTIES WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS TRUE)
    set_target_properties(${libname} PROPERTIES SUFFIX ".pyd")

comments.body:
Shouldn't we do all this here?
https://github.com/root-project/root/blob/master/bindings/pyroot/CMakeLists.txt

Since it is a meta-target for Pythonizations + Cppyy, that would be the place to put it, instead of inside of the CMakeLists of one of the inner targets of the meta-target.

We could have a loop on the Python versions in that `pyroot/CMakeLists.txt` and include the new elements you are adding here, which only concern the meta-target.
I think it is not nice to put in CMakeLists.txt that basically has only ```add_subdirectories```...

Well it has `add_subdirectories` to recursively go into the inner targets, but in my opinion that is the `CMakeLists` of the meta-target, that is the right level. Why would you configure the meta-target inside the inner target pythonizations and not the cppyy one?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@foreach(val RANGE ${how_many_pythons})
  list(GET python_under_version_strings ${val} python_under_version_string)
  list(GET python_major_version_strings ${val} python_major_version_string)
  list(GET python_include_dirs ${val} python_include_dir)
  list(GET python_executables ${val} python_executable)

comments.body: Do we need anything for the Python modules of pythonizations, cppyy and cppyy_backend? Or just doing the liason with the target libraries is enough?
liason with the target libraries should be enough, it should pull other dependencies.

  add_library(PyROOT${python_major_version_string} INTERFACE)
  target_link_libraries(PyROOT${python_major_version_string} INTERFACE cppyy_backend${python_under_version_string} cppyy${python_under_version_string} ROOTPythonizations${python_under_version_string})
